parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To follow after. From kata and akoloutheo; to accompany closely.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Highest, most high, the heights. Superlative from the base of hupsos; highest, i.e. the Supreme, or the heavens.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To declare openly, proclaim, preach, laud, celebrate. From kata and the base of aggelos; to proclaim, promulgate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
